thread.title: Hillary Clinton aides worried about antiquated technology, use of personal email
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton aides worried about antiquated technology, use of personal email

title: Hillary Clinton aides worried about antiquated technology, use of personal email
text:
02 Hillary Clinton aides worried about antiquated technology, use of personal email 
Computerworld: Senior aides to Hillary Clinton when she was secretary of state expressed concerns about the poor level of computer technology at the State Department and the use of personal email by staffers, according to emails released Wednesday.In one email sent on June 3, 2011, a day after Google revealed its Gmail service had been targeted by hackers likely based in China, Anne Marie Slaughter expressed her frustration to Clinton about the State Department's IT system.
